page.title: 10Coleshill,Catholic community
page.content: The Roman Catholic church of the Sacred Heart and St.Theresa in Coleshill is very special because its the only church to be built during the second world war in Europe.It replaced the church which is now the church hall.The Catholic school,St.Edwards has 99 pupils in 1985.Nuns have had a convent in Coleshillfor over a hundred years.Father Hudson bought a large piece of land to build homes and school for orphans from all over the Midlands,and{St.Gerards hospital}for handicapped chidren.The Sisters of Charity of St.Paul came to teach,nurse and look after the children.There were five homes St.Edwards,St.George,St Paul,St.Catherine and St.Joans.St. Joans is the only one open today for children,the remainder are being opened in a few weeks time for the aged and mentally handicapped.
